text: A 1 hour and 11 minute video was
recently released claiming that the
American Communist Party is actually a
group of right-wing fascists. So, let's
go through this video and tally all of
the lies, mistakes, and
mischaracterizations. Right off the bat,
they get Noah Kchievic's name completely
wrong. And Noah Credic trying to explain
the split between ACP and CPUSA without
even mentioning the 32nd Convention and
that the CPUSA is an arm of the
Democratic Party. These guys are far
more wellresourced than your typical
communist or self-described communist
party. No, the ACP is not more
wellresourced than other left-wing
parties in America. Attacking MAGA
communism without citing the original
article that explains what MAGA
communism is. Calling a woman a
misogynist for a tweet without actually
trying to explain why the tweet is
misogynistic. claiming that I'm a
fascist for talking to former UFC
fighter Jake Shields when the entire
podcast was me arguing with him about
how fascism is bad and Jews don't run
the world. I guess talking to people
makes you a fascist now. I wonder how
we're supposed to convince people not to
be fascists without talking to them. And
now they're calling Hazaldin a fascist
for having a conversation with Alexander
Dugan simply because he is right-wing.
Using old tweets that were posted before
the party was even formed to attack the
party's position on Canada. Never
engaging with the party's actual
position or their historical analysis of
the country, saying Hazaldin is a
fascist instead of a Marxist Leninist
for talking about finance capital. as if
Vladimir Lenon doesn't mention it 85
times in his book on imperialism, saying
that the so-called great reset is
nothing but a right-wing boogeyman as if
it isn't literally on the World Economic
Forum's website and as if the World
Economic Forum isn't made up of some of
the most rich and powerful capitalists
in the entire world. Calling the ACP
adherence of Lynden Larouche for saying
that finance capital fedters industrial
development. No, this isn't rooted in
Lynden Larouche. It's rooted in Markx
and Lenin. read these two passages,
including a 20-minute lecture on the
life and theory of Lynden Larouche. As
if I give a Oh no, he's doing the
same thing with Dugan now, isn't he?
Dude, I don't care. Suggesting that
China isn't fighting international
finance capital. Their anti-liberalism
is a fascist rather than Marxist. Hence,
their agilation of Dugan, who most
definitely is not an anti-imperialist
thinker, and they mix it with this idea
of the British financial cabal ruling
the West, and hence their support for
Russia and China. He literally plays a
clip of Dugan saying he's not a
communist or a fascist. Yet supposedly
Dugan's such a raging fascist that H is
a fascist for even talking to him. And H
supposedly agrees with him on everything
even though Dugan openly rejects
communism while H champions it. I refuse
communism and fascism. Calling Dugan the
leader of the Russian far right which is
absolutely not true and reveals a deep
ignorance about Russian politics. He is
a leading intellectual of the ultraist
far right. admonishing H for saying that
Westerners don't understand Dugan while
actively misrepresenting the philosophy
of Dugan, claiming that the ACP wants to
preserve old social formations instead
of moving forward to new and better
ones. But they believe that the answer
is to return to older social forms, even
though our explicit goal is to do the
exact opposite. And we're often attacked
for supporting technological
advancements, claiming that we don't
ever advocate for class struggle,
claiming that we support class
collaboration, claiming that we don't
support seizing any industrial private
property when the nationalization of
major industries is literally in our
program. Which brings us to another
mistake. Judging the party based upon
old tweets from Jackson Hle rather than
the program, the constitution, or the
actual work on the ground. Oh my
goodness, he's rambling about LaRouche
again. I literally can't do this
anymore. alleging that mega communists
long for the postworld war II era of
American history. If he read the
original article on mega communism, he
would know that it's the exact opposite.
We want to point out to mega supporters
that you can't go backwards. You can't
roll back the wheel of history. You can
only go forward to socialism to a state
and an economy that is actually of, by,
and for the American masses, the working
class. The working class is who the
future belongs to. That is what the ACP
believes. And if you want to join the
struggle, you should go to acpus.
[Music]
